intro: Statice juncea, commonly known as sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and spikes of blue to purple flowers. The plant thrives in salty, well-drained soils and is often found in dunes and coastal grasslands. It is widely cultivated for its ornamental value and used in floral arrangements. Statice juncea is also valued for its ability to stabilize soil and prevent erosion in coastal areas.
